entries: You become more nimble, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the Acrobatics skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.
The first time you successfully Tumble on your turn, you gain the benefits of either the {@action Dash|phb} or {@action Disengage|phb} action (your choice).
The maximum height at which you can Roll with fall increases to 100 ft.
Whenever you attempt to Roll on a fall of 50 ft or less, you take half damage from the fall if you fail the check and no damage on a success.

entries: You have studied the secrets of alchemy and are an expert in its practice, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|owl}. If you are already proficient with them, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with them.
As an action, you can identify one potion within 5 feet of you, as if you had tasted it. You must see the liquid for this benefit to work.

Over the course of any short rest as if you were concentrating on a spell, you may improve the potency of any generic recovery potion, such as a {@item potion of healing|owl}, spirit, stamina, magic, etc, regardless of rarity. To use this benefit, you must have {@item alchemist's supplies|owl} with you, and the potion must be within reach over the course of the short rest. The improved potion, referred to as a distilled potion, has advantage on any dice roll that it makes, such as rolls to restore health, spell slots, abilities, or otherwise, alongside increasing its value by 1.5 times its normal price.

entries: Your connection with the outer planes has increased, allowing your planetouched nature to manifest more readily and obviously, granting you the following benefits:

items: Your healing hands now heals an additional amount equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 0).
You grow a pair of feathered, angelic wings from your back, giving you a flight speed equal to your walking speed. For Fallen Aasimar, these wings are batlike.

entries: You also gain an additional benefit depending on what type of Aasimar you are:

items: {@b Fallen Aasimar's} Necrotic Shroud's frighten now lasts for 1 minute, and creatures can save at the end of their turns, ending the effect early on a success. Additionally, the extra damage you can deal on a hit once per turn while it is active increases by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 0).

{@b Protector Aasimar's} Radiant Soul now increases your flight speed by 30 feet while it is active. Additionally, the extra damage you can deal on a hit once per turn while it is active increases by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 0).

{@b Scourge Aasimar's} Radiant Consumption no longer damages you. Additionally, the extra damage you can deal on a hit once per turn while it is active increases by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 0).

entries: You master the techniques needed to train and handle animals. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

You can use a bonus action on your turn to command one friendly beast within 60 feet of you that can hear you and that isn't currently following the command of someone else. You decide now what action the beast will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you issue a general command that lasts for 1 minute, such as to guard a particular area.

entries: You study the arcane arts, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Arcana|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

You learn the {@spell prestidigitation|phb} and {@spell detect magic|phb} spells, along with one other {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|class=wizard} from the Wizard spell list. If you already know {spell prestidigitation|phb}, you may instead learn any {@filter cantrip|spells|level=0|class=Wizard} from the Wizard's spell list. You can cast {@spell detect magic|phb} once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. You can cast the 1st-level spell you chose once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability modifier for these spells.

entries: You've learned some of an artificer's inventiveness:

items: You learn one {@filter cantrip|spells|level=0|class=artificer}, {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|class=artificer}, and {@filter 2nd-level spell|spells|level=2|class=artificer} of your choice from the artificer spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

You can cast this feat's 1st-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can cast this feat's 2nd-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spells using any spell slots you have.

You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice, and you can use that type of tool as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability.

entries: You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:

items: When you are {@condition prone|phb}, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.
You gain a climbing and swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

entries: Your people have extraordinary luck, which you have learned to mystically lend to your companions when you see them falter. You're not sure how you do it; you just wish it, and it happens. Surely a sign of fortune's favor!

When an ally you can see within 30 feet of you rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to let the ally reroll the die. The ally must use the new roll.
When you use this ability, you can't use your Lucky racial trait before the end of your next turn. You can only use this feat a number of times per short rest equal to your proficiency bonus.
You become stronger, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.
You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries: You pride yourself on your quickness and your close study of certain clandestine activities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with them, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with them.
You can pick up items as a bonus action.

entries: Thanks to extensive practice with the crossbow, you gain the following benefits:

items: You ignore the loading quality of crossbows with which you are proficient.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
When you use the Attack action and attack with a one-handed weapon, you can use a bonus action to attack with a hand crossbow you are holding.
Bracing on a wall or table no longer costs any movement.

entries: You master dagger weapons, which are the dagger, jambiya, karambit, kunai, main-gauche, tanto, sai, and small knife. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take the {@action attack|phb} action and make a weapon attack with a dagger weapon, you may make one extra attack with the dagger weapon as a part of that {@action attack|phb} action.
When you score a critical strike with a dagger weapon, you may roll one additional damage die.
You are easily able to conceal dagger weapons on your person when being pat down. Creatures have disadvantage on {@skill sleight of hand|phb} checks when searching you for dagger weapons.

entries: You master dart weapons, which are the blowgun, chakram, dart, needle, and shuriken. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take the {@action attack|phb} action and make a weapon attack with a dart weapon, you may make one extra attack with a dart weapon as a part of that {@action attack|phb} action.
You have techniques of readying multiple dart weapons to be used at once. Whenever you draw or stow a dart weapon, you may draw or stow up to four of them at once, ready for use.
Anytime you make an attack against a creature with a dart weapon, you do not provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb} from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether you hit or not.
You are easily able to conceal dart weapons on your person when being pat down. Creatures have disadvantage on {@skill sleight of hand|phb} checks when searching you for dart weapons.

entries: When you are wielding a finesse weapon with which you are proficient and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you. If you use this reaction and successfully block an attack, it is counted as a successful parry against a creature.
You master the arts of diplomacy, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

If you spend 1 minute talking to someone who can understand what you say, you can make a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion|phb}) check contested by the creature's Wisdom saving throw. If you or your companions are fighting the creature, the creature automatically succeeds. On a failure, the target is {@condition charmed|phb} by you as long as it remains within 60 feet of you and for 1 minute thereafter. On a success, the target is immune to the effects of this feat for 24 hours.
You learn {@spell Charm Person|phb} and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot or material components. Constitution is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries: You have mastered double-ended weaponry, granting you the following benefits:

items: While wielding a weapon with the Double property, you gain +1 AC.

When you attack using a weapon with the Double property, you can make the weapon's secondary attack for free as a part of the attack that you make instead of doing so as a bonus action. You may not attack using the weapon's secondary attack more than once per turn.
If you hit a pair of creatures flanking you using a weapon with the Double property in one turn, they do not gain the benefits of flanking you until the start of your next turn.

entries: You have awakened the latent dragon blood that flows within you, allowing you to mimick the breath weapons of dragons. You gain the following benefits:

items: You grow retractable claws from the tips of your fingers. Extending or retracting the claws requires no action. The claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.
You gain the ability to use the Breath Weapon associated with your draconic ancestry.

When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy known as your Breath Weapon. When you use your breath weapon, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a saving throw, the type of which is determined by your draconic ancestry. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the creature takes damage of the type associated with your draconic ancestry that is a number of {@dice d10}s equal to 1 less than your proficiency bonus. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries: You learn more of the magic typical of dark elves. You learn the {@spell detect magic|phb} spell and can cast it at will, without expending a spell slot. You also learn {@spell levitate|phb} and {@spell dispel magic|phb}, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast those two spells in this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for all three spells
You have gotten quite used to being injured, and pain rarely phases you anymore, as you know you can bounce back from anything. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, the minimum number of hit points you regain from the roll equals twice your Constitution modifier (minimum of 2).
You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against the effects of pain, including holding your breath when taking damage, concentration saves, and spells such as {@spell Power Word Pain|xge}.
You have advantage on all {@dice d20} rolls for determining the severity of a system shock, lingering injury, or fumble.

entries: You have the blood of dwarven heroes flowing through your veins. You gain the following benefits:

items: While under the effects of alcohol, your hit point maximum increases by a number equal to your current level.
You can use an action to perform a healing surge by expending a hit die, gaining hit points equal to the number you rolled plus your Constitution modifier.

entries: You possess keen insight into the world around you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Insight|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.
You can replace any Intelligence or Wisdom skill check with an {@skill Insight|phb} check. You can use this feat a number of times per short or long rest equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries: You master the {@item handaxe|owl}, {@item battleaxe|owl}, {@item greataxe|owl}, {@item warhammer|owl}, and {@item maul|owl}. You gain the following benefits when using any of them:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls you make with the weapon.

Whenever you have advantage on a melee attack roll you make with the weapon and hit, you can knock the target {@condition prone|phb} if the lower of the two {@dice d20} rolls would also hit the target.

Whenever you have disadvantage on a melee attack roll you make with the weapon, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two {@dice d20} rolls would have hit.
You may use a bonus action to target one enemy within range and kick their shield or stance, leaving them Wide Open and thus giving them -1 to their AC until the start of their next turn.

feat.name: Fey Teleportation
entries: Your study of high elven lore has unlocked fey power that few other elves possess, except your eladrin cousins. Drawing on your fey ancestry, you can momentarily stride through the Feywild to shorten your path from one place to another. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn to speak, read, and write {@language Sylvan|phb}. If you already know the language, you may learn a different one instead.

You learn one {@filter wizard|spells|level=0|class=wizard} cantrip of your choice. You also learn the {@spell misty step|phb} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot or its verbal component. You regain the ability to cast it in this way when you finish a short or long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Fey Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

You learn the {@spell misty step|phb} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=D;E} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=D;E} must be from the divination or enchantment school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot or its somatic and material components. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is Constitution.

entries: You possess a special connection to the creatures of the plane you hail from, manifesting in your natural abilities as they increase in power. You gain the following benefits:

items: If you have the Abyssal Resistance feature, you gain two more Variant Features from the selection you had when you became this race, as well as either an additional Variant Head or Variant Body feature.
If you have the Archeronic Resistance feature, creatures that are {@condition Poisoned|phb} by your Black Cloud act as though they were under the effects of the {@spell Confusion|phb} spell.

If you have the Carceric Resistance feature, you learn the {@spell Freedom of Movement|phb} spell and can cast it innately with a range of self and without expending any components a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus.

If you have the Daemonic Resistance feature, you learn the {@spell Far Step|XGE} spell and can cast it innately as an action a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus. When cast in this way, it takes an action for you to teleport instead of a bonus action.

If you have the Gehennic Resistance feature, you gain the ability to speak, read, and write in {@language goblin|phb}. In addition, you learn the {@spell Polymorph|phb} spell and can cast it innately with a range of self and without expending any components a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus. When cast in this way, you can only choose the form of a {@creature Wolf|mm} or, if there is space to grow, {@creature Dire Wolf|mm}.

If you have the Hellish Resistance feature, you may now cast the innate spellcasting given to you from your legacy feature at 3rd and 5th level a number of times per short or long rest equal to your proficiency modifier and a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency modifier respectively.

If you have the Necrotic Consumption feature, you learn the Negative Energy Flood spell and can cast it innately without expending material components a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus.

If you have the Pandemonic Resistance feature, your Mind-Breaking Howl now extends to 30 feet and creatures {@condition frightened|phb} by it become {@condition incapacitated|phb} and have their speed halved

entries: Unholy blood runs strong in you, unlocking a resilience akin to that possessed by the type of fiend you most represent. You gain the following benefits:

items: If you have the Abyssal Resistance, Daemonic Resistance, or Pandemonic Resistance feature, you gain resistance to the two damage types that you did not select from that feature.
If you have the Acheronic Resistance feature, you gain advantage on saving throws against the {@spell Confusion|phb} spell, madness, poison, and resistance to poison damage.
If you have the Carceric Resistance feature, you gain resistance to cold and fire damage.
If you have the Gehennic Resistance feature, you gain resistance to cold and lightning damage.
If you have the Hellish Resistance feature, you gain resistance to cold damage as well as bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered.

If you have the Necrotic Consumption feature, it no longer damages you. Additionally, the extra damage you can deal on a hit once per turn while it is active increases by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 0).

entries: Your connection with the outer planes has increased, allowing your planetouched nature to manifest more readily and obviously, granting you the following benefits:

items: You grow a pair of leathery, batlike wings from your back, giving you a flight speed equal to your walking speed. For Achaierai Tieflings, these wings are birdlike.

You gain an additional physical characteristic, choose one of the following features that you do not already have: small horns; fangs or sharp teeth; a forked tongue; catlike eyes; six fingers on each hand; goatlike legs; cloven hoofs; a forked tail; leathery or scaly skin; red or dark blue skin; cast no shadow or reflection; exude a smell of brimstone.
You don’t provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks} when you fly out of a creature’s reach.

entries: You're filled with vigor, and cling on to the life you live with every fiber of your being. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws when attempting to Bestir.

When you are reduced to zero hit points but are not killed outright, you can make a Constitution saving throw whose DC is equal to the damage taken. On a success, you may perform a healing surge by expending a hit die, gaining hit points equal to the number rolled plus your Constitution modifier. You may do this a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus. However, if you successfully do this two or more times before finishing your next long rest, you gain a Tier of {@condition exhaustion|phb} for each time you succeed after the first.

entries: You've developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling.
You have advantage on all ability checks made to grapple, avoid being grappled, and improve your stance.

entries: You have a quick hand and keen eye when employing firearms, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with firearms (see 'Firearms' in the Dungeon Master's Guide).
You can use a {@item tinderbox|phb} as a free action.
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
Bracing on a wall or table no longer costs any movement.

entries: You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use a {@item healer's kit|owl} to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains 1 hit point.

As an action, you can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and restore {@dice 1d6 + 4} hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice. The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.
Instead, as an action, you can spend one use of a healer's kit as well as one of the target's remaining hit die and have them roll it, regaining HP equal to the number rolled.
You learn the {@spell dote|cooms} spell and can cast it as a ritual.

entries: Your study of history rewards you with the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill History|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

When you take the Help action to aid another creature, the creature gains a bonus to the roll equal to your proficiency bonus, as you share pertinent advice and historical examples. To receive this bonus, the creature must be able to understand what you're saying.

entries: You can spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you who can see or hear you and who can understand you. Each creature can gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier. A creature can't gain temporary hit points from this feat again until it has finished a short or long rest.

When you use this feature, you may simultaneously cast {@spell Motivational Speech|cooms} if you have it as a spell. When you do so, you may additively stack the temporary hit points given by the Motivational Speech with those given by this feat if the targets of the spell and feat intersect.
You have an eye for detail and can pick out the smallest clues. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Investigation|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.
You can take the Search action as a bonus action.
You can use {@skill Investigation|phb} instead of {@skill Survival|phb} for tracking a creature's whereabouts.
You learn the {@spell identify|phb} spell and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot or material components.

entries: You have a mind that can track time, direction, and detail with uncanny precision. You gain the following benefits:

items: You always know which way is north.
You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.
You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.

If you have the ability to Restudy, you can do so with a bonus action once per long rest. This counts towards your maximum number of Restudies for the day, and is instantaneous instead of over the course of an hour.

entries: Choose a class: {@filter bard|spells|level=0;1;2|class=bard}, {@filter cleric|spells|level=0;1;2|class=cleric}, {@filter druid|spells|level=0;1;2|class=druid}, {@filter sorcerer|spells|level=0;1;2|class=sorcerer}, {@filter warlock|spells|level=0;1;2|class=warlock}, or {@filter wizard|spells|level=0;1;2|class=wizard}. You learn two cantrips of your choice from that class's spell list.

In addition, choose one 1st-level spell and one 2nd-level or 1st-level (your choice) spell to learn from that same list. Using this feat, you can cast the 1st-level spell once at its lowest level without consuming a spell slot, and you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the 2nd-level or 1st-level spell once at its lowest level without consuming a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again.
Your spellcasting ability for these spells depends on the class you chose: Charisma for bard, sorcerer, or warlock; Wisdom for cleric or druid; or Intelligence for wizard.
You have martial training that allows you to perform special combat maneuvers. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn two {@filter maneuvers|optionalfeatures|feature type=MV:B} of your choice from among those available to the le to the {@class fighter|phb|Battle Master|Battle Mast archetype in the fighter class. If a maneuver you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

You gain two superiority dice, which are {@dice d6} (this die is added to any superiority dice you have from another source). The dice are used to fuel your maneuvers. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.

entries: You master the physician's arts, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Medicine|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

During a short rest, you can clean and bind the wounds of up to a number of willing beasts and humanoids equal to twice your proficiency bonus. Any additional creatures you wish to do this to requires a usage of a healer's kit to be expent per additional creature. If a creature spends a Hit Die during this rest, that creature can forgo the roll and instead regain the maximum number of hit points the die can restore. A creature can do so only once per rest, regardless of how many Hit Dice it spends

You learn the {@spell dote|cooms} spell and can cast it as a ritual. On top of this, if you cast Dote by expending a charge of a healer's kit, the casting time changes to 10 minutes. This means that ritual casting Dote while expending a charge of a healer's kit makes the casting time 20 minutes.

entries: You have practiced moving in medium armor to gain the following benefits

items: Wearing medium armor doesn't impose disadvantage on your Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|phb}) checks.
Wearing medium armor doesn't hinder your swimming or climbing in any way.
When you wear medium armor, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.

entries: You become fearsome to others, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

You can use a bonus action to attempt to demoralize one creature you can see within 60 feet of you that can see and hear you. Make a Charisma ({@skill Intimidation|phb}) check contested by the target's Wisdom saving throw. A construct or an undead automatically succeeds the save. If the target fails, they are {@condition frightened|phb} of you for 1 minute, remaking the save at the end of each of their turns. Once the target succeeds the saving throw, they can't be {@condition frightened|phb} by you in this way for 24 hours.
You learn {@spell Cause Fear|xge} and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot or material components. Constitution is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries: You've become efficient with the tools of your trade, and are well on the way to being recognized locally for your skills. You gain the following benefits:

items: The time it takes to create an item using your proficient tools is halved.
If you fail to successfully craft a nonmagical item with your proficient tools and would lose the components, you retain the components instead.

Whenever you craft an item using tools that you are proficient in, the item can be marked by your signature at your discretion. This can be a logo, crest, or other form of marking to indicate its origin was yours.

entries: Your extensive study of nature rewards you with the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Nature|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

You learn the {@spell druidcraft|phb} and {@spell detect poison and disease|phb} spells, along with one other {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|class=druid} from the Druid spell list. If you already know {@spell druidcraft|phb}, you may instead learn any {@filter cantrip|spells|level=0|class=druid} from the Druid's spell list. You can cast {@spell detect poison and disease|phb} once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. You can cast the 1st-level spell you chose once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability modifier for these spells.

entries: Always seeking new ways to exploit any weakness you find in a target, you gain the following benefits:

items: Creatures provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks} when they step into a flank between yourself and an enemy of theirs as they expose their back to you.

When an enemy you can see within range becomes Wide Open, you may make an {@action opportunity attack|phb} against them as a reaction, taking advantage of their misfortune. If you caused the Wide Open condition, you can make this attack at advantage. If you use a reaction to make someone Wide Open, you make no more than one {@action opportunity attack|phb} as a part of the same reaction.
If you are using a non-heavy finesse weapon and land an {@action opportunity attack|phb} at advantage, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage.

entries: You have gotten quite good at parrying, so much so that one might even describe you as a 'Parry King'... you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in Parrying Shields.
You gain a bonus of {@dice 1d4} to any Parrying or Interception checks you make.

You can now parry ranged attack rolls. If you completely negate the incoming damage of a ranged attack roll by means of Parrying, instead of the normal effects for successfully parrying or perfectly parrying a melee attack roll, you may redirect the attack to one creature within 5 feet of you. If the attack roll would hit the creature, the creature takes damage equal to the remainder of the potential damage that you could have negated.
You can parry or intercept without using your reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expent usages of this feature when you finish a short rest.

entries: You hone your senses until they become razor sharp. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.
You can take the Search action as a bonus action.
Being in a lightly obscured area doesn't impose disadvantage on your Wisdom (Perception) checks if you can both see and hear.

entries: You master performance so that you can command any stage. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

While performing, you can try to distract one nonhostile creature within 60 feet of you can see who can see and hear you. Make a Charisma (Performance) check contested by the creature's Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you grab the humanoid's attention enough that it makes Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks with disadvantage until you stop performing. On a success, the target is immune to the effects of this feat for 24 hours.
You learn {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|phb} and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot or material components. Constitution is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries: You master polearms, which are the {@item bardiche|owl}, {@item bo staff|owl}, {@item dual-pronged spear|owl}, {@item glaive|owl}, {@item greatscythe|owl}, {@item gythka|owl}, {@item halberd|owl}, {@item javelin|owl}, {@item pitchfork|owl}, {@item pike|owl}, {@item quarterstaff|owl}, {@item rake|owl}, {@item ranseur|owl}, {@item scythe|owl}, {@item spear|owl}, {@item trident|owl}, {@item war scythe|owl}, and {@item yklwa|owl}. You gain the following benefits:

items: All polearms count as Reach weapons for you.

All polearms gain the Double property for you. Polearms that did not have the Double property allow you to use a bonus action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon whenever you take the attack action with said weapon. This attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary attack. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a {@dice d4}, and it deals bludgeoning damage.

When you use a {@item bardiche|owl}, {@item spear|owl}, {@item trident|owl}, or {@item war scythe|owl}, its damage die changes from a {@dice 1d6} to a {@dice 1d8}, and from a {@dice 1d8} to a {@dice 1d10} when wielded with two hands. When you use a {@item quarterstaff|owl}, both its regular attack and secondary attack's damage die increase from {@dice 1d4} to {@dice 1d6}. When you use a {@item javelin|owl}, its damage increases to a {@dice d8} and its range increases to (80/320). When you use a {@item yklwa|owl}, its damage increases to a {@dice 1d10} and its range increases to (20/60).

While you are wielding a polearm, other creatures provoke an {@action opportunity attack|phb} from you when they enter the reach you have with that weapon. If you hit them with that {@action opportunity attack|phb}, they cannot move within 5 feet of you for the duration of their turn.

entries: Much like a dragon as they grow older, your breath weapon has increased in power as you have gotten stronger, granting you the following benefits:

items: The range of your Breath Weapon doubles. If it was a 15-foot cone, it would beome a 30-foot cone. If it was a 5 by 30 foot line, it would become a 5 by 60 foot line.
You may add your Constitution modifier to the damage of your Breath Weapon.

entries: Your natural affinity with primordial magic has increased, and your connection to your Breath Weapon's damage type has granted you the following benefits:

items: You now regain all uses of your Breath Weapon on a short or long rest.
Whenever you use your Breath Weapon, you gain immunity to its damage type until the end of your next turn.

entries: You master punching weapons, which are the bagh nakh, brass knuckles, caestus, katar, and spiked knuckles. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use a bagh nakh, brass knuckles, katar, or spiked knuckles, its damage die changes from {@dice 2d2} to {@dice 3d2}. WHen you use a caestus, its damage die changes from {@dice 1d4} to {@dice 1d6}.
Whenever you damage a creature with a punching weapon, you may immediately use a bonus action to attempt to shove that creature.
You have advantage on attack roles made against creatures {@condition grappled|phb} by you when attacking with a punch weapon.

entries: Your nimble fingers and agility let you perform sleight of hand. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Sleight of Hand|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

As a bonus action, you can make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check to tie or untie a rope, plant something on someone else, conceal an object on a creature, lift a purse, or take/interact with something from a container on a person, including a holstered weapon, arrows from a quiver, or igniting a bomb.

entries: Your body has the ability to recover quickly from mortal wounds, and is unusually receptive to healing magic. You gain the following benefits:

items: Whenever you are raised from the dead, you do not suffer any of the penalties that other creatures do as a result of being raised.

Whenever you regain hit points from any source, including from when you wake up and gain 1 hit point after being knocked {@condition unconscious|phb} or raised from the dead, you can choose to perform a healing surge by expending a hit die, gaining hit points equal to the number rolled plus your Constitution modifier.

feat.name: Shadow Touched
entries: Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

items: You gain 60 feet of {@sense darkvision|phb}, which is added onto any existing {@sense darkvision|phb} you have, if any.

You learn the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell and one {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N} of your choice. The {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|school=I;N} must be from the illusion or necromancy school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot or its verbal and material components. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can't cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells' spellcasting ability is Constitution.

entries: You use shields not just for protection but also for offense. You gain the following benefits while you are wielding a shield:

items: If you take the {@action Attack|phb} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.
If you aren't {@condition incapacitated|phb}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.

If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.
You may ignore the Wide Open property of shields.

entries: You master sickle weapons, which are the sickle, kama, and kusarigama. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take the {@action attack|phb} action and make a weapon attack with a sickle weapon, you may make one extra attack with the sickle weapon as a part of that {@action attack|phb} action.
When you score a critical strike with a sickle weapon, you may roll one additional damage die.
When you prompt a system shock or lingering injury with a sickle weapon, the creature has disadvantage on Constitution saves to avoid it.

entries: You develop your conversational skill to better deceive others. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.

You may use a bonus action to attempt to deceive one humanoid you can see within 30 feet of you that can see and hear you. Make a Charisma (Deception) check contested by the target's Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from the target and your attack rolls against it have advantage; both benefits last until the end of your turn. On a success, the target can't be deceived by you in this way for 24 hours.
You learn {@spell Disguise Self|phb} and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot or material components. Constitution is your spellcasting modifier for this spell.

entries: You know how best to hide. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.
If you are hidden, you can move up to 10 feet in the open without revealing yourself if you end the move in a position where you're not clearly visible.

entries: You master wilderness lore, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.
Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), you remain alert to danger.
If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When you forage, you find twice as much food as you normally would.
While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

entries: You have inherited the innate spellcasting ability of your ancestors. This ability allows you to cast {@spell nondetection|phb} on yourself at will, without needing a material component. You can also cast each of the following spells once with this ability: {@spell blindness/deafness|phb}, {@spell blur|phb}, and {@spell disguise self|phb}. You regain the ability to cast these spells when you finish a long rest.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells, and you cast them at their lowest possible levels.

You achieve a profound connection with The Weave, allowing you to further understand your own spellcasting as well as connect with any magical items you may come across. Your maximum attuned items increases by an amount equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). Additionally, choose one of the following benefits:

items: If you are a prepared caster, your maximum prepared spells increases by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

If you are a spontaneous caster, you learn an amount of spells equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) from your class' spell list. If you are multiclassed, you may only pick spells from the classes in which you spontaneously cast.
You learn either the {@spell Magic Dagger|cooms}, {@spell Magic Dart|cooms}, or {@spell Prestidigitation|cooms} cantrip.

entries: Through masterful planning, perceptive cunning, or the ability to throw yourself headfirst into any situation you come across, you gain the ability to assert yourself in combat more precisely. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to your initiative equal to the modifier of the chosen ability score increase

Before combat starts, after everybody has rolled initiative, you may choose to willingly lower your initiative by any amount. If there is an ability that affects you if you have not taken your first turn in combat yet, it instead counts your original initiative before you lowered it as being your first turn in combat.

entries: Your extensive study of religion rewards you with the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Religion|phb} skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise in the skill. If you are already an expert in the skill, you may gain proficiency in another skill of your choice

You learn the {@spell thaumaturgy|phb} and {@spell detect evil and good|phb} spells, along with one other {@filter 1st-level spell|spells|level=1|class=cleric} from the Cleric spell list. If you already know thaumaturgy, you may instead learn any cantrip from the Cleric's spell list. You can cast detect evil and good once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. You can cast the 1st-level spell you chose once without expending a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability modifier for these spells.

entries: You have mastered the art of throwing weapons while fighting, causing your hands to be quick when it comes to equipping and aiming a weapon.

items: Weapons with the thrown property have their normal range extended to their maximum range for you.

Weapons are a lot harder to lose than ammunition, and you've learned to keep a keen eye out for weapons you throw. When you attack using a weapon with the thrown property and miss, the weapon becomes a physical object on the map that can be picked up or interacted with. Thrown weapons that hit are instead always able to be looted off of the enemy that you hit them with.

Because you are so accustomed to swapping held items constantly, you have learned how to keep weapons on your person ready to be used. You can draw items into your hands or stow items onto your person as a free action during your turn up to a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries: Your body can take a beating; it takes a lot before you're willing to throw in the towel. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to twice your level when you gain this feat. Whenever you gain a level thereafter, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 2 hit points.

entries: You have practiced casting spells in the midst of combat, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your {@condition concentration|phb} on a spell when you take damage.
You can perform somatic components with non-focus weapons or shields in hand as well.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an {@action opportunity attack|phb}. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

entries: You master Whip weapons, which are the whip and urump. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take the {@action attack|phb} action and make a weapon attack with a whip weapon, you may make one extra attack with the whip weapon as a part of that {@action attack|phb} action.
Urumi now counts as reach weapons for you.
When you attempt to disarm a creature with a whip weapon, you are not put at a -5 to hit with the weapon.
When you successfully disarm a creature using a whip weapon, you are able to immediately grab the item you are disarming as long as you have a free hand equipped that can reasonably carry the object.

entries: You learn the magic of the primeval woods, which are revered and protected by your people.

items: You learn two druid {@filter cantrips|spells|level=0|class=druid} of your choice. You also learn the {@spell longstrider|phb} and {@spell pass without trace|phb} spells, each of which you can cast once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast {@spell longstrider|phb} in this way when you finish a short or long rest, and you regain the ability to cast {@spell pass without trace|phb} in this way when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
